Player History
Drafted in 1st round, 18th overall pick, by Minnesota in 1982...
Traded from Minnesota to Boston on 7/21/1983 (Going to MIN: C J. Bench. Going to BOS: LF D. Pasqua)...
Traded from Boston to Minnesota on 7/31/1985 (Going to MIN: 3B T. Teufel, LF D. Pasqua. Going to BOS: P R. Guidry)...
Injured on 5/25/1987 with a Bruised Neck, out for 4 days...
Had first career hit on 4/1/1988, off John Verhoeven (CLE)...
Hit first career homerun on 4/9/1988, off Doug Bird (DET)...
Injured on 8/12/1988 with a Concussion, out for one week...
Won World Series with Minnesota in 1988...
Injured on 4/4/1989 with a Pulled Calf Muscle, out for 2 weeks...
Won Gold Glove Award at Leftfield in 1989...
